meico.midi

Class MidiPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.midi.MidiPlayer

  • public class MidiPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides Midi playback functinality.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      void close()
      closes all activity of this MidiPlayer

      returns the length of the midi sequence in microseconds or 0 if none is loaded

      obtains the current position in the sequence, expressed in micoroseconds

      obtains the current position in the sequence, expressed as relative value between 0.0 (beginning) and 1.0 (end)

      • play

        public void play(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence,
                 double relativePlaybackPosition)
          throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        start playing the midi sequence at the given relative position (between 0.0 and 1.0)
        Parameters:
        sequence - midi sequence
        relativePlaybackPosition - relative playback position to start, should be in [0.0, 1.0]
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException

      • play

        public void play(Midi midi,
                 double relativePlaybackPosition)
          throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        start playing the midi sequence at the given relative position (between 0.0 and 1.0)
        Parameters:
        midi - the Midi instance to be played back
        relativePlaybackPosition - relative playback position to start, should be in [0.0, 1.0]
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException

      • play

        public void play(Midi midi,
                 long playbackPositionInTicks)
          throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        start playing the midi sequence at the given relative position (between 0.0 and 1.0)
        Parameters:
        midi - the Midi instance to be played back
        playbackPositionInTicks - this sets the tick position where to start the playback
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
